body:
Hi @donalmurtagh, thanks for the issue. 

> In the documentation for the new flat config [an example](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files-new#configuring-the-javascript-version) configures the JavaScript as languageOptions.ecmaVersion.

> However, [an example in the migration guide](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/configuration-files-new#configuring-the-javascript-version), the path to this property is languageOptions.parserOptions.ecmaVersion.

Both of these example links are pointing to the same docs link. Can you please correct it?
@Rec0iL99 sorry about that, I've updated the links

I don't think this is a mistake in the docs. The migration guide indicates that the `parserOptions` key has been moved into `languageOptions` in the new config system. So, it is showing a difference between how a configured `parserOptions` key in `eslintrc` would look like in flat config. You can pass any required options via the `parserOptions` key for the parser to know when parsing code.  

To specify the JavaScript version ESLint should use during linting, you need to set it in `languageOptions.ecmaVersion` (the default is `ecmaVersion: "latest"`).

cc @mdjermanovic

@donalmurtagh You're correct, the migration guide example is a mistake. When using the default parser, `ecmaVersion` and `sourceType` belong under `languageOptions` rather than `parserOptions`.

Would you be willing to submit a PR to correct that?

issue.title: docs: fix migration-guide example

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)
added `ecmaVersion` and `sourceType` keys in `languageOptions`

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?
Fixes #17771
